text: Joseph Allen "Country Joe" McDonald (born January 1, 1942) is an American musician, singer and political activist. He was the lead singer of the 1960s psychedelic rock group Country Joe and the Fish.Richard Brenneman, "Country Joe McDonald Revives Anti-War Anthem" , Berkeley Daily Planet, April 16, 2004, accessed July 18, 2007. He is known for his role during the Free Speech Movement in Berkeley, California and for his songs during the Counterculture of the 1960s. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:American political activists Category:American rock guitarists Category:American bluegrass musicians Category:American country singers Category:American country guitarists Category:American folk singers Category:American folk musicians Category:Musicians from Washington, D.C. Category:Singers from Washington, D.C.
title: Country Joe McDonald
